channel.title: Solenoid connection help
channel.description:
im working on a project with solenoids and using a 24v dc powersupply and an 8x relay module board to power them. im not sure where the problem is; i can get the relay board to respond to the digital outputs of the axoloti (LEDs on the board light up) but im not getting the relays or the solenoids to respond.
is it possible the digital outputs (PA0, PA1.. ) wont do the job here?

item.title: Solenoid connection help
item.dc:creator: @wishniak
item.description:
@wishniak wrote:

or dust off the old arduino . thanks for the info though..

Read full topic

item.title: Solenoid connection help
item.dc:creator: @Gavin Gavin
item.description:
@Gavin wrote:

In that case you may want to wire in a switching transistor or a 3.3v to 5v logic level converter.

Read full topic

item.title: Solenoid connection help
item.dc:creator: @wishniak
item.description:
@wishniak wrote:

aha - very good tip - i just assumed axos output the same as an arduino (5v) and since these boards are essentially made for arduinos ("and other microcontrollers") would therefor be compatible. . this is probably my problem

ebay.de

8 - Kanal Relais Modul 5V / 12V / 24V Relay Interface Relais Modul Optokoppler ...

8 - Kanal Relais Modul 5V / 12V / 24V Relay Interface Relais Modul Optokoppler in Business & Industrie, Automation, Antriebe & Motoren, Sch√ºtze, Relais & Motorstarter | eBay!

Read full topic

item.title: Solenoid connection help
item.dc:creator: @Gavin Gavin
item.description:
@Gavin wrote:

How much voltage is required to activate the relays ? it should have the details..
The Axo only puts out 3.3 volts, this might not be enough unless the module board is configured to accept it.

Read full topic
